channel.title: Acta on NetSec
channel.description: Recent content in Acta on NetSec

item.title: Acta #008
item.description: The agenda: Malialis, K., & Kudenko, D. (2015). Distributed response to network intrusions using multiagent reinforcement learning. Engineering Applications of Artificial Intelligence, 41, 270–284. doi:10.1016/j.engappai.2015.01.013 [sci-hub link] Tomic, I., & McCann, J. A. (2017). A Survey of Potential Security Issues in Existing Wireless Sensor Network Protocols. IEEE Internet of Things Journal, 4(6), 1910–1923. doi:10.1109/jiot.2017.2749883 [sci-hub link] Krishnamurthy, P., Karri, R., & Khorrami, F. (2019). Anomaly Detection in Real-Time Multi-Threaded Processes Using Hardware Performance Counters.

item.title: Acta #007
item.description: The agenda: Tor Traffic Identification Stealing, Spying, and Abusing: Consequences of Attacks on Internet of Things Devices NetChain: Scale-Free Sub-RTT Coordination

item.title: Acata #006
item.description: The agenda: Threat Analysis for Wearable Health Devices and Environment Monitoring Internet of Things Integration System Robustifying Network Protocols with Adversarial Examples

item.title: Acta #005
item.description: The agenda: An Efficient Opportunistic Routing Protocol for ICN Dynamic Optimal Countermeasure Selection for Intrusion Response System RESTful HTTPS over Zigbee: Why and how?

item.title: Acta #004
item.description: The agenda: Towards a Cyber Defense Framework for SCADA Systems Based on Power Consumption Monitoring Situational Awareness for security adaptation in Industrial Control Systems A Multi-Classifier Network-Based Crypto Ransomware Detection System: A Case Study of Locky Ransomware

item.title: Acta #003
item.description: The agenda: WADI: a water distribution testbed for research in the design of secure cyber physical systems Towards Understanding Man-on-the-Side Attacks (MotS) in SCADA Networks

item.title: Acta #002
item.description: The agenda: Blockchain Radio Access Network (B-RAN): Towards Decentralized Secure Radio Access Paradigm A Re-evaluation of Intrusion Detection Accuracy: Alternative Evaluation Strategy Towards Malware Detection via CPU Power Consumption: Data Collection Design and Analytics

item.title: Acta #001
item.description: After last weeks meeting, we decided each meeting we will discuss three papers. The agenda: A Deep Learning Approach to Network Intrusion Detection Implementing Zero Trust Cloud Networks with Transport Access Control and First Packet Authentication Intelligent Security Measures for Smart Cyber-Physical Systems
